A number of Perry Middle School sixth-grade students earned more than 100 points in the Accelerated Reader program.

Accelerated Reader allows students to take quizzes on the books they read and earn points. The students who earned over 100 points received a special award and a T-shirt designed by sixth grader Chloe Dutcher. The shirts were sponsored by Cafe Sports in Perry.

The top three sixth-grade students with the most points earned a gift certificate to Schuler Books care of the Parents in the Middle organization. Those students were Logan Crank (297.1 points), Nathaniel Cochrane (375 points) and David Zheng (1615.1 points). Zheng broke all of the Perry Middle School AR records this year.

"Perry Middle School Principal Matt Schmidtfranz said his school applied for a grant because 'We see a need for students to be more active and to embrace a healthy lifestyle.'

Three teachers ‚Äî Patrick Logghe, Travis Rockafellow and Kendra Randolph ‚Äî applied, scoring an $1,800 grant. Logghe and Rockafellow are leading a personal conditioning class for sixth- and seventh-graders featuring two days of nutritional instruction and three days of functional fitness using new step, weight-lifting and conditioning equipment.

Randolph is incorporating the Michigan nutrition model into science lessons, and leading short physical activity breaks during class.

The Perry Middle School PTO pitched in, donating $500 toward the new fitness equipment, Schmidtfranz said.

'The equipment and educational items will help students reinforce positive nutritional habits, and reinforce staying active and physically fit,' the principal said."
